page.title: 10 THE NESS COASTLINE
page.content: The Ness is quickly eroding and in 1875 the Ness was much further out. The water used to come right up into the bank by the Shaldon Bridge (which at the time was not built) but it was filled in to build St. Peter's Church. Smuggler's Tunnel was built by Lord Clifford for easy access to Ness Beach. The steps are shallow so that a wheelchair could travel down it. There was a proper smuggler's tunnel by the gates that lead to Lord Clifford's private land. This had pits in it so that the treasure could be hidden in here and covered over with dirt.
